body: The thing about reposting on reddit is, most people *didn't* see it the last time. Getting all worked up because someone posts something that someone else did 10 years ago isn't worth it imo. They probably didn't even know it was posted before.
body_html: The thing about reposting on reddit is, most people didn't see it the last time. Getting all worked up because someone posts something that someone else did 10 years ago isn't worth it imo. They probably didn't even know it was posted before.

body: Just capping guilds is not quite going to cut it. The admins have to stay vigilant that they never arbitrarily hand certain users or guilds special privileges or communication without a way for others to gain said status. Otherwise the guild cap wouldn't matter because 1) they would have site-wide influence, and 2) they could easily spread out the guildmaster positions amongst themselves.
body_html: Just capping guilds is not quite going to cut it. The admins have to stay vigilant that they never arbitrarily hand certain users or guilds special privileges or communication without a way for others to gain said status. Otherwise the guild cap wouldn't matter because 1) they would have site-wide influence, and 2) they could easily spread out the guildmaster positions amongst themselves.

body:
I don't know how many times I've seen a post on Reddit for the first time and the top comment is "Hur hur, OP is a reposting karma whore".

So, it doesn't really bother me unless I see the same post on 15 different subs, many of them from different usernames.

post.body: Censorship is a obvious no, but what are some features that the Ruqqus should absolutely not implement into the site? Whether it be UI or code related.
post.body_html: Censorship is a obvious no, but what are some features that the Ruqqus should absolutely not implement into the site? Whether it be UI or code related.
post.title: What are some features that Ruqqus should avoid/never implement?

body:
I think bots are OK with some restrictions:

1. A bot should never pop up unsolicited. The bot must be either explicitly allowed by the guildmasters *or* requested by the user in a standardized way.
2. A bot should never pretend to be a human being. 
3. A bot should be always associated with a single human owner who can take the blame for it.
body_html:
I think bots are OK with some restrictions:

  1. A bot should never pop up unsolicited. The bot must be either explicitly allowed by the guildmasters or requested by the user in a standardized way.
  2. A bot should never pretend to be a human being.
  3. A bot should be always associated with a single human owner who can take the blame for it.
